body.name: ARCTIC Alpine 17 LP - Low-Profile CPU Cooler for Intel LGA 1700, 92 mm PWM Fan, Low Installation Height: 42.9 mm, 4-pin Connection, 300-3000 RPM, Tool-Free Push-pin Installation, top Blower
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 20 mins
features: COMPATIBILITY: The ARCTIC Alpine 17 LP is a Low-Profile CPU cooler specifically designed and developed for the new Intel Socket LGA 1700
COMPACT: With a low installation height of only 42.9 mm, the Alpine 17 LP is compatible with most all-in-one systems and small SFF cases (mini-ITX, mATX, HTCP, barebone, etc.)
EFFICIENT COOLING: The 92 mm fan can be controlled via PWM and ensures flexibility and efficient cooling performance with a wide rpm range from 300 to 3000 rpm
EASY & TOOL- FREE INSTALLATION: Pre-applied MX-4 thermal paste and pre-assembled push pins enable a quick installation, ideal for system integrators
GOOD HEAT DISSIPATION: Fine Y-shaped fanned cooling fins ensure a considerable increase in the cooling surface and simultaneous optimisation of the airflow
body.description: Technical Specifications Compatibility Intel Socket: 1700 RAM Clearance: unlimited Heatsink Heatsink: Radial Material: Aluminum Thermal paste: MX-4 Pre-applied Fan Fan Diameter: 92 mm Speed: 300 - 3000 rpm Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Noise Level: 0.5 Sone Current/Voltage: 0.18 A Connector: 4-Pin PWM-Fan-Connector Speed Control: Pulse Width Modulation - PWM

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Low-Profile Design With an installation height of only 42.9 mm, the Alpine 17 LP is particularly suitable for small and narrow housings. It is space-saving, easy to assemble and allows full access to all components close to the CPU. The compact Top-Blower CPU cooler also cools areas around the CPU socket and is predestined for HTPC and Mini-ITX cases.

Low-Profile Design With an installation height of only 42.9 mm, the Alpine 17 LP is particularly suitable for small and narrow housings. It is space-saving, easy to assemble and allows full access to all components close to the CPU. The compact Top-Blower CPU cooler also cools areas around the CPU socket and is predestined for HTPC and Mini-ITX cases.

Designed for Intel Alder Lake & Raptor Lake The Alpine 17 LP is specifically adapted and optimised for Intel's new LGA1700 CPUs. The radial cooler and the mounting spots are designed so that the centre of the cooler is centred on the CPU. Thus, the processor’s hotspot in all variants is covered by the aluminium core. Easy And Tool-Free Installation Installation is very easy thanks to the push pins and the cooler’s light weight. The cooler can be easily mounted on the built-in motherboard without any tools. Thanks to the snap-in mechanism of the push pins, the cooler can be reliably installed at all times, even in the case of vibrations. Wide rpm Range The Alpine 17 LP features an updated motor with a very wide PWM-controlled RPM range from 300 up to 3000 RPM. At low system load, the fan switches off almost completely. This keeps the noise level at a minimum while offering maximum cooling performance under stress.

Pre-Applied MX-4 Thermal Paste The popular, very efficient MX-4 thermal compound is already pre-applied and not only ensures a quick and clean installation - the PREMIUM Performance Thermal Paste also eliminates air pockets and ensures perfect transfer of the exhaust heat from the processor IHS to the Alpine 17 LP's heat sink. The MX-4 from ARCTIC is characterised above all by its very good long-term durability. High-Quality Bearing Thanks to an alloy/lubricant combination developed in Germany, friction inside the bearing is reduced and higher efficiency is achieved. As a result, there is less heat development, less bearing noise and the service life of the fan is extended. Great Technology The extra fine Y-shaped, fanned-out cooling fins ensure a considerable increase in the cooling surface and optimisation of airflow. A novel production process makes it possible to extrude the fins even more finely without making them unstable. This enables the production of a powerful, but at the same time, very flat and compact radial heat sink.

Technical Specifications Compatibility Intel Socket: 1700 RAM Clearance: unlimited Heatsink Heatsink: Radial Material: Aluminum Thermal paste: MX-4 Pre-applied Fan Fan Diameter: 92 mm Speed: 300 - 3000 rpm Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Noise Level: 0.5 Sone Current/Voltage: 0.18 A Connector: 4-Pin PWM-Fan-Connector Speed Control: Pulse Width Modulation - PWM Size & Weight Length: 95 mm Width: 95 mm Height: 55.45 mm Installation Height: 42.9 mm Weight: 183.5 g

Alpine 17 LP Alpine 17 Alpine 17 CO Alpine 23 Alpine 23 CO Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Dual Ball Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Dual Ball Bearing Technology Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling AMD Socket / / / AM5, AM4 AM5, AM4 Intel Socket 1700 1700 1700 / / Fan 92 mm 92 mm 92 mm 92 mm 92 mm Fan Speed 300–3000 rpm 100–2000 rpm 250–2700 rpm 100–2000 rpm 200–2700 rpm Noise Level 0.5 Sone 0.3 Sone 0.5 Sone 0.3 Sone 0.3 Sone Dimensions 95 x 95 x 55.5 mm 95 x 95 x 78.8 mm 95 x 95 x 78.8 mm 121 x 98.6 x 65 mm 121 x 98.6 x 65 mm Installation Height 42.9 mm 66.25 mm 66.25 mm 65 mm 65 mm Weight 183.5 g 288 g 288 g 275.5 g 275.5 g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great. One of the push pins took excessive force to get all the way in. Had the cpu at 32*C after in the bios for about 5 mins.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Like others have said it goes on hard but it was way easier to install with a flat screwdriver than with figures

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price
reviews.reviewText: So far, so good. If you are able to get a better cooler, I highly recommend you do so, but if this is the only one that fits your budget, it does the job. It's also very quiet, hardly noticeable unless you're using close to 85% CPU Usage. The reason I put it at 4 stars instead of 5 is because of how hard it was to lock in and take out. Took me about 2 hours to attach. If I didn't notice it wasn't attached properly, my CPU would have been fried due to overheatingPaired it with the 12600k.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Randomly stopped running as cool
reviews.reviewText: For around a month of use this cooler was ok averaging 30-40°c but now it is the exact opposite running at 50-100°c. This is unacceptable, this cooler should have not just randomly decreased in how cool it keeps my PC. Btw I routinely clean out my PC of dust so that is not the reason.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive CPU cooler that I had a MAJOR problem with
reviews.reviewText: I hate giving a negative review to an item that is now performing its job perfectly well. But I believe I went far above what most people would have done to get to this point. And it's possible that my combination of processor and motherboard exacerbated the problem, but I have no way to judge that... and unfortunately, neither will you...So the downside first: it just didn't fit. I've built a lot of computers, and when it comes time to install the CPU cooler, you learn that you have to push down vigorously on the mounting pins to lock them in place. The instructions even show the difference between "unlocked" and "locked" mounting pins as they protrude through the mounting holes in the motherboard. No matter how hard I tried, pushing down with my considerable body weight applied, I could not get all four mounting pins to their "locked" position. I could tell this was going to be a problem because the cooler could rock from side to side as it sat on the processor. (my combo was a MSI motherboard and an Intel i7-12700K processor). Was the processor too thick?I literally spent a couple HOURS trying to get this cooler installed, completely evaporating the value of buying one of the most inexpensive coolers... even my (retired) hours are worth more than this. At some point I was afraid I might have damaged the processor - how much pressure can they take being squeezed into a socket? MOST people would have given up by now and returned the unit, but sadly I'm not "most" people. Off to the garage to grind down the metal heat sink...Whew, that aluminum is surprisingly robust! It took another hour and a lot of inhaled aluminum dust to grind down that heat sink. Yes, I was using my belt sander, but I really thought it would be easier than it was... that solid aluminum core doesn't give way easily. After an enormous amount of work, I probably shaved off only a mm or so... but fortunately, that was enough. When I reinstalled the heat sink to the fan, and applied some thermal paste (I had ground off the pre-applied paste), the mounting pins clicked into place with what I felt was the appropriate amount of pressure applied.So now... the cooler is running fine and quite silently, and keeping the processor temperature well inside the "safe" zone. My sub-$10 cooler was a bargain if you don't consider the $100 worth of effort. Maybe try it and if it works for you, great - but if it doesn't fit - don't think twice!!! - return it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I like it
reviews.reviewText: You have push hard for latch to lock one 2nd and 4th corner clips but its quiet, pretty, and effective on 65 watt or less CPUs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Impossibly difficult to install.
reviews.reviewText: It's really hard to install. It's probably 7c better than a stock intel cooler but in my case the mounting was so bad it didn't make contact and my CPU overheated

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars HOT HOT HOT
reviews.reviewText: This cooler sucks! It does not work worth a damn, and the mounting system is horrible. I bought this to hold me over for a few days but it can not even do that. Returning this. DO NOT BUY. GET A NOCTUA
Molto buono ed è veramente silenziosa e performante a un buon prezzo.. consiglio

Tengo un PC de escritorio con más de 20 años que monta una Placa Base Asus P7h55d-m Pro Intel con un procesador Intel i5-650.Al principio parecía que los anclajes del disipador no encajaban con los huecos de la placa, pero sólo he tenido que encontrar la posición correcta para ajustarlo perfectamente. No he tardado ni 10 minutos.Anoche, el PC se ponía a 97° con sólo encenderlo.Ahora, la CPU mantiene unos estupendos 32° a pleno rendimiento.Muy recomendable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rapporto qualità/prezzo/efficacia strepitoso, qualche difetto minore.
reviews.reviewText: Dissipatore efficace e senza fronzoli, che offre buone capacità di raffreddamento e silenziosità d'utilizzo ad un prezzo contenuto.L'installazione è stata rapida, leggendo altre recensioni avevo il dubbio che avesse difficoltà di aggancio alla scheda madre, ma nel mio caso (As Rock con socket LGA 1700) non è stato così; è vero che ho visto sistemi di aggancio migliori, ma questo è economico, funzionale e solido una volta installato.Viene dotato all'origine di uno strato di pasta termica che, anche se non protetta da pellicola, mi è parsa adatta all'uso, anche se di più non posso dire perché ho l'abitudine di assemblare utilizzando pasta termica nuova da tubetto (in questo caso ho usato peraltro un prodotto di questa stessa marca), dunque ho pulito via quella d'origine.Avevo scelto questo dissipatore anche per motivi di estetica, visto che lo volevo abbinare a banchi di ram bianchi con dissipatore argb, e non sono stato deluso. Anzi a chi assembla badando anche all'aspetto estetico ed ha un budget ridotto posso dire che le ventole bianche riflettono bene i colori dei componenti argb e così si può ottenere un effetto gradevole anche senza ricorrere a più costosi dissipatori a led.Il funzionamento è sempre silenzioso entro circa il 60% del regime massimo, da lì in avanti tende a farsi sentire di più, ma è principalmente rumore di flusso d'aria, non sento ronzii elettrici.Per la mia esperienza è un prodotto dal rapporto qualità/prezzo/efficacia strepitoso, certo ho utilizzato anche dissipatori migliori e dotati di tutto (pure di piastrina metallica col logo del produttore da appiccicare al case), pagandoli però molto di più: se non state cercando dissipatori argb o per utilizzi molto intensi o superaccessoriati, a questo prezzo (12/13 Euro al momento del mio ordine) non abbiate dubbi.
Die Montage war etwas schwierig aber Preis/Leistung ist sehr gut.
